answers.answer: Your symtoms could gastritis causing migraine. I too have experienced it sometimes .Do you get heard burn?Try some antiulcer drugs like famotidine or Pantaprozole .Avoid getting gastritis or heart burn which could help in decreasing the above symptoms.Drinking lot of water and exercise. also helps.But if the problem persists please take a second opinion.

Hi,There is not a known association between headache and bloating/dyspepsia. Nonetheless there could be another medical problem that may be responsible for both the symptoms. An example could be anxiety. Do you suffer from stress/anxiety/related problems? Do you have any other medical problems such as hypertension or diabetes?  You may want to try out symptomatic treatment  for headaches such as tylenol and antacid drugs as suggested. If the problems persist, kindly go in for an evaluation by the  physician.

im not sure i've heard of heard burn... im only 16, my mom doesn't believe in taking drugs unless its serious and she thinks this isn't serious due to what the doctor said. I have had plently of water thats all i drink, my exersize is very good. i jog to work, and gym class works me hard. lol. also these lumps r relly hard but i can move them around.i dont think i have any other diseases... not that i know of. i take stress and that pretty well. well i dont have to worry about much other than school but i've been doing good and no tests or anything coming up.

Thanks so much for the comments. Really appreciate that.I went to the doctor this morning. The pain was really bad last night. He thinks it is a tension headache. He said to keep taking the drops/tablets plus he gave Norgesic and something to chew against the gas.I have diabetes and I think I have been quite stressed lately, although I try not to tell myself that. I am still able to work and do my everyday things.  I haven't slept at regular hours, I did get some sleep, just at very odd hours.Oh and I also told my doctor that the pain started a few hours, after I switched the air conditioner on. Could it be a 'cold'? Is that possible that part of your head catch a cold?...Thanks again for the comments/advice/input.

question: Hi,I would like some input/comments/advice on what I am having. It has been a week that I am suffering from a constant pain at the back of my head, on the right side mostly. It moves a little around but always on the right side. The pain can be really intense for a few seconds, then when it goes, I feel a constant pressure in the head. Sometimes it moves  to the front behind my right eyebrow or cheekbone. I have taken painkillers but nothing is working. I saw the doctor yesterday, he gave some herbal stuff. Drops and tablets.The pain can also be burning. I have noticed something. I don't know if it is related but when I have the pain and I apply some pressure with my fingers, I feel gas in my stomach, and then I burp a lot. Every time I feel the pain, I do that, I burp... Even just now, my cheekbone is painful, and I press on it, I burp. What could that be? Please can anyone help? I am finding it harder and harder to deal with. I am at work and it is hard to focus...Thanks for reading and trying to help...
title: Pain on right side of back of head
